sect1.title: Unstructured Diagnostic Interviews
sect1.para: Unstructured diagnostic interviews Unstructured diagnostic interviews give the practitioner the freedom to ask questions and follow-up on responses in any manner that they see fit. Unstructured diagnostic interviewing provides expansive opportunities for the interviewer to develop strong rapport and therapeutic alliance with the client (Mueller & Segal, 2014 ). The flow, sequence, and content of unstructured diagnostic interviews can be guided by one’s theoretical orientation, training, knowledge base, comfort, and interpersonal style. A client’s response style can also guide the interview. Perhaps the client is quite verbal, and you can obtain a rich history and understanding of the presenting problems without too many interruptions. Conversely, you may have a client who is more guarded, and this provides you with the opportunity to build a stronger rapport and trust with the client while you obtain the minimum information needed for a diagnosis.
